entries.title: GOP Prods Raimondo on Export-Control Files, Citing China Concern
entries.description: A top Republican lawmaker asked the Commerce Department for documents linked to the enforcement of export controls on sensitive technologies, amid concerns that the Biden administration isn’t doing enough to restrict China’s access to advanced semiconductors.

entries.title: UK Awards Delayed £2.1 Billion ‘Levelling Up’ Funding to Regions
entries.description: The UK awarded £2.1 billion ($2.6 billion) of funding to regional infrastructure and regeneration projects from Scotland to Cornwall, following months of delay to the allocations due to political turmoil in Westminster.

entries.title: Yellen, Liu Avoid Airing Complaints as US-China Tone Warms
entries.description: US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen and Chinese vice-premier Liu He ahead of their meeting in Zurich, on Jan. 18.

entries.title: Turkey Predicts F-16 Sale Approval Even as US Resistance Remains
entries.description: A senior Turkish official said he expects the US to approve his country’s purchase of F-16 fighter jets, even as divisions between the Biden administration and Congress over the deal are likely to hold up a delivery of the planes.

entries.title: FTX Debacle Shows Risks in Current CFTC Rulebook, Commissioner Says
entries.description: Digital-asset exchange FTX’s implosion shows that US platforms should face heightened scrutiny from the Commodity Futures Trading Commission before being able to list crypto assets, according to one top official at the regulator.

entries.title: China’s Reopening Is the Boost the Flagging World Economy Needs
entries.description: The easing of Covid restrictions will unleash pent-up demand for commodities, consumer goods and travel.

entries.title: Peru Protesters Head to Lima to Try to Topple Boluarte
entries.description: Peruvian police patrol the Pan-American highway at La Joya on Jan. 12. (Photo by DIEGO RAMOS/AFP via Getty Images)

entries.title: US Weighs Stryker Vehicles in Ukraine Aid Package Set for Friday
entries.description: The Biden administration is considering Stryker armored vehicles for its next package of military aid to Ukraine, adding another new and more powerful weapons system that it had previously withheld, people familiar with the matter said.

entries.title: White House Accuses GOP of ‘Economic Vandalism’ Over Debt Limit
entries.description: Representative Andy Biggs, a Republican from Arizona, attends the first session of the 118th Congress in the House Chamber in Washington, DC, US, on Tuesday, Jan. 3, 2023. House GOP leader Kevin McCarthy failed to win the speakership in the first round of voting as a small group of party dissidents delivered a stunning political rebuke to the California Republican that previews potential turmoil in the chamber over the next two years.

entries.title: NJ to Provide Free Health Care for Undocumented Children
entries.description: New Jersey Governor Phil Murphy announced free state-paid health care for thousands of undocumented immigrant children, as Democratic leaders elsewhere in the US say they’re overwhelmed with busloads of border crossers sent North.

entries.title: NJ Accountant Pleads Guilty in $1.3 Billion Green Tax Fraud Case
entries.description: A New Jersey accountant pleaded guilty to participating in a scheme to sell $1.3 billion in fraudulent tax deductions supposedly aimed at preserving green space.

entries.title: Gunfire Damages Third North Carolina Power Station as FBI Investigates
entries.description: The FBI is investigating another power substation in North Carolina that was damaged by gunfire, the third such facility to be targeted in the state since early December.

entries.title: Swiss President Under Pressure Over Allegations of Covid Leaks
entries.description: The timing couldn’t be worse for newly-appointed Swiss President Alain Berset.

entries.title: DeSantis’s Get-Parents-Fired-Up Strategy Holds Clues to a 2024 Run
entries.description: To win reelection, Florida Governor Ron DeSantis harnessed the power of one of the most coveted groups of voters anywhere — motivated parents. The strategy could build a key pillar of support if, as widely expected, he runs for president in 2024.

entries.title: Fed’s Beige Book Says US Price Growth Seen Moderating in 2023
entries.description: Growth in US prices is expected to ease in the year ahead, contacts surveyed in the Federal Reserve’s latest Beige Book said.

entries.title: McHenry Is the Republican to Watch in the US Debt-Limit Showdown
entries.description: A senior House Republican who is both an ally to Speaker Kevin McCarthy and a trusted negotiator in the fractured party is emerging as a potential savior in Washington from debt-ceiling economic disaster.

entries.title: Trump Campaign Asks Meta to Reinstate His Facebook Account
entries.description: Donald Trump’s campaign is asking Facebook’s parent company to reinstate his access on grounds he’s a declared 2024 presidential candidate and that keeping him off the platform is interfering with the political process.

entries.title: Gun Retailers Rejected by Supreme Court on New York Regulations
entries.description: The US Supreme Court refused to block new safety and record-keeping requirements that apply to New York gun retailers, letting the provisions stay in effect while a legal fight goes forward.

entries.title: Navy’s Newest Submarine Leaves Pentagon Baffled on When It Will Be Ready
entries.description: Officials overseeing development of the US Navy’s next-generation submarine to carry nuclear missiles don’t have the information they need to know whether the first vessel in the $132 billion Columbia program can deploy on time in 2031, an unreleased congressional audit found.

entries.title: Why Europe Is Fuming Over America’s Green Subsidies
entries.description: President Joe Biden is offering about $370 billion in subsidies and tax breaks to boost green industries and cut US greenhouse-gas emissions. But some of America’s largest trading partners — most importantly the European Union — say the measures will unfairly benefit US companies and violate World Trade Organization rules. Washington and Brussels have often sparred over state support for sectors ranging from aircraft manufacturing to banana and beef production and biotechnology. If this latest f

entries.title: Fed Chair Powell Tests Positive for Covid-19, Has Mild Symptoms
entries.description: Federal Reserve Board Chair Jerome Powell tested positive for Covid-19 and is experiencing mild symptoms.

entries.title: Scholz Tells Global Elite in Davos That German Economy Is Back
entries.description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz came with an upbeat message to the World Economic Forum in Davos: Europe’s biggest economy is back, after being painfully cut off from Russian gas.

entries.title: UK Seeks Brexit Fudge Deal to End Dispute Over European Court
entries.description: The UK is exploring a possible compromise over the role of the European Court of Justice in Northern Ireland, one of the most difficult sticking points in ongoing negotiations about post-Brexit trading arrangements.

entries.title: European Parliament Head Plans Firewalls Against Corruption
entries.description: The European Parliament will build “firewalls” and “ring alarm bells earlier” to prevent cases of corruption like the one involving allegations of bribes being paid to lawmakers related to Qatar and Morocco, its head said.

entries.title: Malaysia Growth Will Be Key for Ringgit This Year, Zafrul Says
US Debt-Crisis Worries Sour Davos Optimism on Global Economy
entries.description: The global financial elite gathering in Davos, Switzerland, this week warned of the dangers stemming from the looming US federal debt-limit fight, a potential crisis that overshadowed any cheer from a reopening of China’s economy and diminishing recession risks in Europe.

entries.title: Summers Is More Optimistic on US Outlook Than He Was a Few Months Ago
entries.description: Former US Treasury Secretary Lawrence Summers said he’s more optimistic about the US economy and its ability to dodge a recession than just a few months ago, although he warned the Federal Reserve still faces a tricky task.

entries.title: Bullard Says Fed Rates Need to Stay on Tighter Side in 2023
entries.description: Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis President James Bullard said US interest rates have to rise further to ensure that inflationary pressures recede.

entries.title: Chile Rejects $2.5 Billion Mine Project on Environmental Risks in Snub to Business
entries.description: A victory for President Gabriel Boric’s green agenda has business groups fuming

entries.title: Israel High Court Disqualifies Netanyahu Ally from Cabinet Post
entries.description: Israel’s High Court of Justice disqualified an ally of Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu from serving as a minister, a decision which could threaten to unravel the newly-formed government.

entries.title: Al Gore Criticizes Detention of Greta Thunberg in German Protest
entries.description: Al Gore, chairman of Generation Investment Management LLP, speaks during a Bloomberg Television interview at the COP27 climate conference at the Sharm El Sheikh International Convention Centre in Sharm El-Sheikh, Egypt, on Wednesday, Nov. 9, 2022. More than 100 world leaders are set to be in Sharm el-Sheikh, Egypt over the next two weeks for the UN’s annual climate talks. Photographer: Islam Safwat/Bloomberg

entries.title: Global Tax Reform May Add $250 Billion a Year to Public Coffers
Snow and Ice Trigger Weather Warnings Across Parts of Britain
entries.description: Snow and ice warnings are in place for western parts of the UK as below-average temperatures are set to continue into the end of the week.

entries.title: European Executives Eye Biden’s Green Plan With Envy in Davos
entries.description: Brussels is coming under pressure from European business to respond to the US’s multi-billion dollar clean energy subsidy plan or risk losing investment and falling behind in the green energy revolution.

entries.title: Xi Says China’s Covid Fight in New Stage, Faces Tough Tasks
entries.description: China’s President Xi Jinping called for more efforts on fighting Covid in a rare video speech addressing citizens to celebrate the upcoming Lunar New Year holidays.

entries.title: UN-Backed Panel Urges Ethiopia to Cooperate with Atrocities Probe
entries.description: A United Nations-backed panel that’s probing human-rights violations during Ethiopia’s civil war called for the government’s full cooperation after its investigators failed to secure access to the scenes of some alleged crimes.

entries.title: EU Seeks Large Consensus on Fiscal Rules Before Proposing Change
entries.description: Paolo Gentiloni

entries.title: Yellen Hints at Beijing Visit After Meeting Liu in Zurich
entries.description: The US Treasury hinted that plans are under way for Secretary Janet Yellen and her counterparts in China to hold meetings later this year in Beijing and Washington, continuing the two governments’ efforts to ramp up face-to-face engagement between senior officials.

entries.title: Indonesia Tells Myanmar to Let ‘Qualified People’ Run Government
entries.description: An Indonesian senior minister urged Myanmar’s military to consider stepping back and letting “qualified” leaders govern the country that’s in an economic free-fall due to sanctions and worsening civil strife.

entries.title: Ukraine Seeks to Add Steel to Grain Export Deal, Minister Says
entries.description: Ukraine wants to expand a crucial grain-export agreement to include steel shipments as a way to support an economy battered by Russia’s war, Economy Minister Yuliia Svyrydenko said in an interview.

entries.title: Congo Presidential Contender Katumbi Sees Security as Top Priority
entries.description: Moise Katumbi, who is seen as a serious contender in the Democratic Republic of Congo’s upcoming presidential elections, said he’s confident of winning a clean contest outright and that he’ll prioritize building a professional army and maintaining peace and security if he does.

entries.title: Gambian Vice President Dies in India After Brief Illness
entries.description: Gambian Vice President Badara Alieu Joof died in India after a “brief illness,” President Adama Barrow announced in a Twitter post.

entries.title: EU Needs Member States to Replenish Bloc’s Budget, Official Says
entries.description: The European Union will need to ask member states to make fresh contributions to the bloc’s budget to fund a growing list of priorities, including support for its industries and addressing fallout from the war in Ukraine, the EU executive arm’s top economy official said.

entries.title: UN Head Warns of a ‘Perfect Storm’ of Global Challenges
entries.description: Antonio Guterres in Davos on Jan. 18.

entries.title: Blackstone CEO Schwarzman Says US Needs New Generation of Political Leaders
entries.description: Blackstone Inc. Chief Executive Officer Steve Schwarzman said the US needs a new raft of leaders in both political parties.

entries.title: China’s Censors Vow to Erase ‘Gloomy Emotions’ Over Holiday
entries.description: China’s censors have launched a campaign to ensure a “festive and peaceful” mood prevails in the Asian nation as it nears its most important holiday while deaths from Covid-19 rise.

entries.title: Gender Dispute Fuels UK Constitutional Clash
entries.description: Nicola Sturgeon has made a name for herself as a liberal foil to the UK Conservative government.

entries.title: US Has Overspent Because of Its Fractured Politics, Rajan Says
entries.description: Public borrowings in the US and elsewhere have swelled because of overspending partly fueled by fractured politics, said former International Monetary Fund Chief Economist Raghuram Rajan.

entries.title: Saudi Arabia Says Days of Unconditional Foreign Aid Are Now Over
entries.description: Saudi Arabia signaled a shift in how it offers financial help to countries, making future aid conditional on promises to revamp their economies.

entries.title: The School Board Queen Endorsed by Florida Governor Ron DeSantis
entries.description: Part one of “The School Board Queen” podcast miniseries introduces Bridget Ziegler, the mom and board member training conservatives to run for school boards

entries.title: The Idea of ‘Parental Rights’ in Education Goes Back to the 1950s
entries.description: Part two of “The School Board Queen” podcast miniseries looks at the history of the conservative movement in US education, going back to the 1950s.

entries.title: The School Board Queen: How a Florida Mom Is Shaking Up US Education
entries.description: Bridget Ziegler is a leader in the parental rights movement focused on US school board elections. The final episodes of the “Bedrock, USA” podcast examine her conservative agenda.

entries.title: What Bridget Ziegler’s Agenda Means for LGBTQ Youth
entries.description: Part three of “The School Board Queen” podcast miniseries examines why Bridget Ziegler has been labeled “racist” and “transphobic” by her opponents.

entries.title: China Masses Take Covid Fight Into Own Hands as Xi Sits Back
entries.description: Left to fend for herself after China abruptly ended the world’s strictest Covid restrictions, 31-year-old Share Xue and her daughter found themselves with 40C (104F) fevers and an expired bottle of Motrin.

entries.title: Chile Experts Warn of Unforeseen Risks in Constitution Rewrite
entries.description: Chile investors who breathed a sigh of relief when voters rejected a new constitution last year should brace for more months of political grandstanding and bickering as the process kicks off once again, two of the country’s top legal experts said.

entries.title: Latvian Premier Backs New President Term for Putin Critic Levits
entries.description: Latvian Prime Minister Krisjanis Karins said he supported a second term for President Egils Levits, who as the Baltic nation’s head of state has been harshly critical of Vladimir Putin’s invasion of Ukraine.

entries.title: War in Ukraine Strains Ties Between Putin and His Old Serb Ally
entries.description: Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic used to speak regularly with his Russian counterpart. The conflict is now testing relations between the two.

entries.title: Poland Wants Allies to Send Up To 100 Tanks to Support Ukraine
entries.description: Poland expects European allies to send as many as 100 battle tanks to support Ukraine’s defense efforts against Russia’s invasion, Prime Minister Mateusz Morawiecki said.

entries.title: Trump Questioned Nigerian President About Killing of Christians
entries.description: Former US President Donald Trump asked Nigeria’s leader about the killing of Christians in the West African nation during a visit to the White House in 2018.

entries.title: Modi Urges His Hindu Nationalist Party to Help India’s Muslims
entries.description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi urged members of his ruling party to reach out to Muslims and other religious minorities, a rare move to tone down sectarian tensions as he prepares to host the Group of 20 summit later this year.

entries.title: Turkey Mounts Pressure on Sweden Ahead of F-16 Talks With US
entries.description: Turkish Foreign Minister Mevlut Cavusoglu applied fresh pressure on Sweden to make concessions as he traveled to the US for talks on the sale of F-16 fighter jets, which may depend on Turkey’s ratification of the NATO expansion.

entries.title: Ukrainian Interior Minister Killed in Helicopter Crash Near Kyiv
entries.description: A helicopter crash near the Ukrainian capital killed at least 16 people, including the nation’s interior minister.

entries.title: US and China Pledge to Talk More to Avoid Worsening Tensions
entries.description: The top US and China economic officials held their first face-to-face meeting Wednesday, pledging to improve communication as a way to avoid more serious confrontation during a period of heightened tensions.

entries.title: French Government Is Open to Small Changes to Pension Reform
entries.description: The French government is open to tweaking its pension reform plan, French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire said in an interview with France Info radio on Wednesday.

entries.title: US Debt Standoff Is Risk World Doesn’t Need, IMF’s Gopinath Says
entries.description: The Congressional standoff over raising the limit on US federal borrowing is a risk that neither the country nor the rest of the world ought to face, according to the International Monetary Fund’s No. 2 official said.

entries.title: Davos Latest: IMF’s Gopinath Sees Resilience in Global Economy
entries.description: Gita Gopinath, the International Monetary Fund’s No. 2 official, said the global economy has shown “signs of resilience,” and European Central Bank Governing Council member Francois Villeroy de Galhau predicted that the euro region should avoid a recession this year.

entries.title: Ukraine Latest: Zelenskiy Vows to Reinforce Air-Defense
entries.description: Ukraine can now rely on three Patriot batteries that will significantly bolster air-defense, but the country is weighing steps to reinforce it further, President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said. He praised Dutch Prime Minister Mark Rutte for pledging to provide Ukraine with another Patriot system, which can shoot down missiles.

entries.title: The Key Contenders to Replace Vietnam’s Ousted President
entries.description: The race to fill one of Vietnam’s top four political positions has begun after Nguyen Xuan Phuc became the biggest name yet to fall in an anti-corruption campaign led by conservative ideologues in the Communist Party.

entries.title: Another Imran Khan-Backed Pakistan Province Calls Early Election
entries.description: Pakistan’s second provincial legislature was dissolved and its government was sacked on the instructions of former leader Imran Khan as he mounts pressure on Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif to call snap polls, deepening the South Asian nation’s political and economic crisis.

entries.title: Women Are Macron’s Biggest Critics in Pension Reform Protests
entries.description: Patricia Humbert has never joined a demonstration in her life. But for the first time, the 57-year-old teaching assistant is considering protesting against Emmanuel Macron’s flagship pension reform.

entries.title: Australia’s First US Black Hawk Helicopters to Arrive in 2023
entries.description: The first helicopters in Australia’s new fleet of US-designed Black Hawks will arrive by the end of the year, Deputy Prime Minister Richard Marles said, further strengthening security ties between Canberra and Washington.

entries.title: Ex-HK Leader Carrie Lam Excluded From China’s Top Advisory Body
entries.description: Carrie Lam, who as Hong Kong’s leader presided over the city’s most turbulent period in decades, failed to make it on to China’s top advisory body in the latest lineup.

entries.title: Philippine Court Acquits Nobel Laureate Ressa of Tax Evasion
entries.description: A Philippine court acquitted Nobel laureate Maria Ressa and her media company Rappler of tax evasion charges filed during the Rodrigo Duterte administration, a move that may ease concerns over media freedom in one of Asia’s oldest democracies.

entries.title: Threats Against Lawmakers Decreased in 2022, Capitol Police Say
entries.description: Direct threats or “concerning statements” made against members of Congress decreased in 2022, reversing an upward trend over “the last couple of decades,” the US Capitol Police said Tuesday.

entries.title: How Same-Sex Marriage Could Become Legal in India
entries.description: India’s highest court will hear arguments on whether to legalize same-sex marriage on March 13, a landmark for the country of 1.4 billion people and for the global movement for LGBTQ rights. A ruling that finds gay marriages are allowed under India’s constitution would run counter to the socially conservative sentiment of Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s Hindu-nationalist Bharatiya Janata Party, as well as wide swaths of the country’s Muslim community. But younger Indians tend to be more accepting

entries.title: Nurses on Strike Say People Are Dying in UK’s Health Service
entries.description: Nurses said people are dying unnecessarily in the UK’s beleaguered National Health Service as they kicked off another day of strikes for higher pay.
